channel.title: Portfolios on Charlene Miskulin
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on Charlene Miskulin

item.title: Dukie Pergola
item.description: 2014 Dukie was looking at the koi fish in the pond before looking up at me. The overhead pergola is reflected in the water. 16’x20’ Canvas in oil.

item.title: Wolf in Snow
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Girl and Horse
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: He Doesn't Know it's Me
item.description: When I was a little girl, I loved horses with all my heart. Being raised outside of Chicago, there were no real horses within a 50 mile radius. To this day, I still have a love for horses and they are my all time favorite subject to paint. The subject is Beau my very first horse. I painted in the moment before he recognises me, someday, in heaven. 36”x48” canvas in oil (2015)

item.title: Lonely Cow Dark
item.description: In “Lonely Cow Dark”, the trailer in the background will likely be used to take him to processing. Lonely cow is actually a calf that was weaned from his mother near Boyd, Texas. He would see me drive up in my little black car and was convinced it was his mom. He would run to the fence and call out to my car. This little calf was alone in a massive pasture and wanted to make a connection with someone.

item.title: Lonely Cow Day
item.description: In “Lonely Cow Day”, the barn in the distance offers shelter without companionship. Lonely cow is actually a calf that was weaned from his mother near Boyd, Texas. He would see me drive up in my little black car and was convinced it was his mom. He would run to the fence and call out to my car. This little calf was alone in a massive pasture and wanted to make a connection with someone.

item.title: Dallas Carousel
item.description: This is one of the beautiful horses on the carousel at the Dallas Zoo. I also love painting carousel horses. They were the first horses I fell in love with as a little girl. 16”x20” canvas in oil, 2015

item.title: Dukie
item.description: Dukie is a 4 year old Morkie, half Maltese, and half Yorkie. He is owned and loved by my daughter Cally. She brings him over to visit, and he is fascinated by the fish in the pond. He likes to pose for pictures and is very easy for me to paint. 16’x20’ canvas in oil.

item.title: My name is Dukie... Not Dookie
item.description: He sat so cute for me and posed for me to take his picture. I painted his portrait soon after. 2015 - 16”x20” canvas in oil.

item.title: Buddy Splashing
item.description: In this painting I did not use a brush but tried my hand at painting with a palette knife. Buddy is a breeding stock paint horse. Typically paint horses have white markings on their body but Buddy was an exception without any. Oil on canvas 2015

item.title: Dukie Loves Koi
item.description: I actually turned the canvas upside down to paint his reflection in the water. Oil on canvas (2015)
